title: Champs without mana should not have ability to poke
body: {{champion:238}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:157}} can spam their shit as much as they want

replies.body:
With energy users, using an ability limits the abilities they can cast next. Their energy regenerates quickly, but their abilities cost a huge percentage of their resource compared to a mana user. A mana user can use all of their abilities in tandem and need to go through several rotations before their resource will limit what they will cast, but an energy can't go through their full rotation on-cooldown. If they spam even one of their abilities for poke, they won't have enough energy to all-in. They need nearly a full bar before they can commit. 

Yasuo landing a Q at melee range isn't poke, it's a trade. Poke is where neither champion can commit on the other, and you're whittling down each other's health. If Yasuo is hitting you with his Q and it isn't a tornado, he's basically in melee range of you, and you can fight back. The fact that you aren't doesn't make it poke, it's him winning the trade because you don't have a cooldown available to contest him. Name one melee champion that doesn't have an ability that could hit another champion at that range or let them close a gap that small. 

Champions that are resourceless, like Riven and Yasuo, are gated heavily by cooldowns. Their cooldowns are generally longer than other champions, making them heavily dependent on CDR items and/or a level lead to be effective. They suffer hard if you can stay ahead of them. Their cooldowns are valuable resources in themselves, so if you can bait one early, like Yasuo's Windwall or Riven's shield, you can easily win trades in that extended window.
this man really used riven and long cds in the same sentence
And yasuo.  His only cooldown is W, which is one of the greatest get out of jail free card abilities in the game

>
> this man really used riven and long cds in the same sentence

Yes, she does. All of her cooldowns are above 10 seconds at rank 1, and only one of them goes below 10 seconds at max rank, and she has no CDR or resets built into her kit. Her cooldowns are long. This is why Riven maxes out CDR as fast as she can. This makes her item dependent, so if you can set her behind in gold, she will struggle.

> All of her cooldowns are above 10 seconds at rank 1

The fact that you aren't doesn't make it poke, it's him winning the trade because you don't have a cooldown available to contest him. Their cooldowns are valuable resources in themselves, so if you can bait one early, like Yasuo's Windwall or Riven's shield, you can easily win trades in that extended window.

{{champion:101}} 
"Hey, is mana a resource that's implemented to discourage players from carelessly spamming their abilities and completely preventing the enemy from doing anything? Let's give this guy a passive that makes his resource completely redundant!"

No. They actually gave him that passive to make is laning phase have interaction. 
He has such high range and wave clear that he cant be interacted with, so riot made his spells cost 120 mana so he would oom in a few casts and the massive mana cost couldn't be negated with flat mana or mana regin.
He has to auto minions or players (autoing just minions still ooms him hard early). 
If they removed his passive he couldn't lane at all, and if he could via mana cost reductions, you'd never see him on your screen just hitboxes and explosions.
then they made mana flowband, and That percentage mana regin from total invalidated his costs...
.

while there are many exceptions to this im mainly focusing on energy users. While some energy users do have poke, its not exactly equal to lets say a mages poke. For example most mages either do more dmg comparing 1 ability for another, or they have better "utility" (using this fairly loosely to cover cc,aoe, and range) Almost all energy users  abilities are either meant to be used in close range or are purely for burst. Zed for example who probably has the most range misses out on alot of dmg unless he is able to proc electrocute or hits them directly instead of through minions. With his poke combo (W-E-Q) he only has enough energy to press E once more once its off cd then thats it, he is completely out of energy until it regens. (though he does get refunded energy if it hits multiple people) While mages can do their full combo many times before they run out of mana, and some can even do the same combo multiple times before zed gets his energy back such as ryze, and cass. There are many other examples on why some champs use energy over mana, im just naming a few of the pros and cons of both sides.

Energy users typically dont do well at all in poke especially in the late game as most are designed to be assassins. Late game mages such as Xerath, Vel, and Brand can do full combos non stop until they run out of mana depending on their items. Mana is by design more suited for late game while energy is more suited for either early game or burst.

I dont expect you to be convinced by this or anything anyone says. Im just pointing out there are two sides to every coin. It might just help to look at both sides before complaining about one.

Also by your logic mana users shouldnt be able to burst. :D
Yasuo poke requires 2 hits and is rather telegraphed though.

His issue isn’t poke. It’s poke that doesn’t have a real cost.

I’ll use a previous example being yasuo
His poke comes from his q 1 and 2. 
It cost him a very low cooldown. That’s it. 

Gangplank on the other hand, also poke with his q. 
It costs him a significantly longer cooldown. 
Costs him mana
And if he wants any extra damage with it, it costs his a barrel charge.

There are plenty of hidden costs that you are forgetting.

GP Q is a point and click ability with 200 more range than Yasuo's skill shot which can be predicted, dodged, or flashed. GP cd on Q is 5 seconds while yasuo's Q is 4 seconds until he gets attack speed. That along with GP getting extra Gold for last hitting or poking with Klepto. all that And also considering the items and mana regen GP still will struggle early game atleast in trading and killing but just farming and poking GP wins with the extra gold he gets.

Now your throwing in what if’s to the game. 

We could account yasuo as having conquerer stacked as well, suddenly he is healing for a huge chunk as well. 

Not to mention if we are talking extra gold. Gangplank will never equal yasuo in gold per stats due to yasuo gaining 2000 gold worth of stats for free. 

Point being. Yasuo has a low cooldown poke tool, that when used correctly (when the enemy is getting a cs) cannot be dodged. And has zero cost. 

Gangplank has a poke tool that can’t be dodged. But also has a longer cooldown and a mana cost
